intro: Trimerisma trifoliatum, commonly known as the three-leaved trimerism, is a small, herbaceous plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf shapes and often edible parts. The plant typically has three leaflets arranged in a triangular pattern, giving it its common name. It produces small, greenish-white flowers in spring, which are clustered in dense inflorescences. Trimerisma trifoliatum is often found in moist, shaded areas such as woodlands and along stream banks.
